alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Several clusters of thunderstorms will impact portions of central Isle of Wight, and southeastern York Counties, the southern City of Poquoson, the City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the northwestern City of Virginia Beach, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 515 PM EDT... At 416 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of thunderstorms along a line extending from Langley AFB to near Windsor. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 to 40 mph. Rainfall up to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locally heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hampton, Langley AFB, Hampton University, Northampton and Fort Monroe around 420 PM EDT. Grand View and Buckroe Beach around 425 PM EDT. Driver around 440 PM EDT. Chesapeake, Bowers Hill and Western Branch around 450 PM EDT. Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth and Cradock around 500 PM EDT. Regent University around 510 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Fox Hill, Carrollton, Portlock, Phoebus, Langley View, Longview, Benns Church, Huntersville and Wills Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York
